reviews.review_msg: Gary is an amazing prof and his lectures are very interesting! The class was super easy; 2 exams, a research paper, and participation. The exams were super easy and at the time were take-home 48-hour exams, but study for the exams by reviewing readings and lecture slides

He is great. The tutorials are said to be discussions when they are not. However he is a great explainer with passion, and if he is wrong or misunderstood he admits fault instead of pulling the authority challenge. Amazing and an OG of sfu communications

I absolutely loved going to his class in the morning, it literally felt like a ted talk. He makes you so engaged, and tries hard enough just to get your attention, but not so much that it's overbearing. It doesn't hurt that the TA's are extremely nice as well, and generally easy markers.
amazing prof, hilarious and outstanding. Ideal Prof.

I think I am in love with Gary, seriously I am really bad about skipping class- but I lived to go to Gary's lectures. He was always funny and engaging and basically possessed all the qualities one could hope for in a prof. Also, if you do the most readings you will get a good grade in the class, exam format is super fair- he wants you to pass.
He is a good professor, but his classes can be boring and long. Very easy course

3rd year and he's the best prof I had at SFU. Sparks great interest when relating material to  current events. Topics and approaches are modern and engaging.  I wish all my communication courses were taken with this prof.  Either attending lectures or completing all readings is decent for exam prep.
Gary is so funny and smart! He is able to convey information so well in dialouge that it doesn't even feel like you're learning. He is great all around!

very intelligent guy, word efficient so be sure to take down what he says word by word. Exam essay topics are more relating to course material articles rather than matherial in his lecture. But sometimes these 2 things are inter-related. Overall, a good interesting prof, and a not very hard course.

this was a very interesting course, not hard if you do the reading.  However, my TA gave 80% maximum for anything written and called it "perfect".  I nearly "aced" it and still got a B+. I'm imagining the highest was A- for anyone who
great lectures, very interesting, easy to understand and personable
Best prof I've had at uni. Im I third year and no one is more fluent and easy as him. Just show up to class understand his teachings and give your own examples in exams.

He is one of the best professor that I have ever taken by far. He is very passionate when it comes to teaching. His tests are easy and you will easy get an A+. In class, he delivers lot of examples along with lecture content. He made me wanna study communication more . He is funny and generous to guide you if you wanna get good marks .
He's really awesome !!!! Learning a lot from his lecture !!!
THE BEST AND MOST INTERESTING PROF ALIVE UPTODATE... im not even kidding
